title: Particulate diagram - soln after AgCl precipitates

content.question:
Ag+(aq) + Cl—(aq)   ⇄   AgCl(s)

A student mixes dilute AgNO3(aq) with excess NaCl(aq) to form AgCl(s), as represented by the net ionic equation above. Which of the diagrams below best represents the ions that are present in significant concentrations in the solution? (Ksp for AgCl is 1.8 x 10−10.)

choices.label: A diagram shows a container that holds, four N O 3 minus ions and four N a plus ions. Precipitate in the container is labeled, Solid A g C l.
A diagram shows a container that holds, four C l minus ions and four A g plus ions. Precipitate in the container is labeled, Solid A g C l.
A diagram shows a container that holds, two C l minus ions, two N O 3 minus ions, and four N a plus ions. Precipitate in the container is labeled, Solid A g C l.
A diagram shows a container that holds, two C l minus ions, two N O 3 minus ions, two A g plus ions, and two N a plus ions. Precipitate in the container is labeled, Solid A g C l.

content.answer: A diagram shows a container that holds, two C l minus ions, two N O 3 minus ions, and four N a plus ions. Precipitate in the container is labeled, Solid A g C l.

skill.text: 3.C: Represent visually the relationship between the structures and interactions across multiple levels or scales (e.g., particulate to macroscopic).
